feature: Extract duplicated LLM client HTTP request handling
description: The LLM client implementations (openai.go, anthropic.go, gemini.go) contain nearly identical HTTP request handling logic in their GenerateCompletion methods. Each implements the same pattern: marshal JSON, create HTTP request, execute with retry, read response, check status code, parse response, check for API errors.

phases.name: Design HTTP request helper
phases.description: Design the signature and structure for a generic HTTP request handler that eliminates duplication across LLM clients

subtasks.name: Analyze duplicated pattern
subtasks.description: Document the exact duplicated pattern across openai.go, anthropic.go, and gemini.go GenerateCompletion methods
subtasks.notes: Created pattern-analysis.md documenting the 8-step duplicated pattern, code metrics (101 lines), and provider-specific logic

subtasks.name: Design helper function signature
subtasks.description: Design doHTTPRequest helper function with parameters: context, method, url, headers, requestBody. Returns: responseBody bytes
subtasks.notes:
Created comprehensive helper-function-design.md documenting:
- Complete function signature with full documentation
- Design decisions for each parameter and return type
- Step-by-step implementation behavior
- Error handling strategy
- Usage examples for all three providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini)
- Benefits analysis (code reduction, maintainability, consistency)
- Verification criteria
- Implementation notes (thread safety, context support, memory management, extensibility)

subtasks.name: Identify provider-specific logic
subtasks.description: Confirm that provider-specific logic (convertRequest, convertResponse, API error field checks) will remain in each client implementation
subtasks.notes:
Created comprehensive provider-specific-logic-confirmation.md documenting:
- 5 categories of provider-specific logic that must remain
- Request format conversion (convertRequest) for each provider
- Response format conversion (convertResponse) for each provider
- API authentication mechanisms (Bearer token, x-api-key, URL param)

- Additional response validation (error field checks, safety blocks)
- Summary table showing what stays vs. what gets extracted
- Verification that provider-specific behavior is preserved
